greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows in which row n lists the divisors of n, written in base 2.
comment: Numbers of triangle A027750, written in base 2.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..7069
example: The divisors of 10 are 1, 2, 5, 10 then row 10 lists the binary numbers 1, 10, 101, 1010.
maple: with(numtheory):for n from 1 to 10 do for d in divisors(n) do printf("%d, ",convert(d,binary)); od:printf("\n");od: # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Apr 19 2011
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 22 2010
